result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont R Johnson

records.addlTxt: Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lamont R Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Lamont R Johnson.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel requests adjournment for status.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Lamont R Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Lamont R Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Plevak, State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court sets bail at $10,000 cash

All other conditions to remain as previously imposed
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lamont R Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Holland Reed in court for Lamont R Johnson.  Attorney Jack Eichorst, appearing for Samuel Tufford, in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case recalled; defendant now present in court.
Arguments to the Court by the State and defense counsel.
For reasons stated on the record, Court will modify bail.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Lamont R Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Holland Reed in court for Lamont R Johnson.  Attorney Jack Eichorst, appearing for Samuel Tufford, in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel reviews State's motion.
Arguments to the Court by the State.
Defense counsel statements to the Court.
Court orders case passed to produce defendant in court.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Lamont R Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court for Lamont R Johnson.  Attorney Samuel Tufford in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case could not be called on the record on today's date as court is in trial on an unrelated case.
Case is adjourned to September 12, 2022 for bail review in Branch 28.

Public Defender's office notified via electronic mail as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Lamont R Johnson not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a bail review and status of counsel.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

State has filed a motion for bail review and requests a bail hearing.  Counsel has not yet been appointed as to this case.
Case is scheduled for bail hearing in Branch 28 on September 9, 2022.  Public Defender's office notified via electronic mail as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms

Bail/Bond Review scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Motion To Review Commissioner's Bail Decision - received
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J N B-W. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lamont R Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for Lamont R Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3, and 4.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
